alert.note: Alert for Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 28 at 10:48PM PDT until October 29 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS NOW THROUGH SUNDAY... .North-northeast winds continue across the ridges of the North Bay, East Bay, Santa Cruz Mountains, and the Santa Lucia Mountains. Dry, offshore winds will peak tonight into Sunday morning, which will result in elevated fire weather concerns. During the overnight hours, offshore winds could mix down into the interior valleys of the North Bay and East Bay. Gusts of 30 to 40 mph will be possible with locally higher gusts up to 60 to 70 mph across ridgetops and higher peaks. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT SUNDAY FOR GUSTY OFFSHORE WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR ZONE 517... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 517 Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest. * WINDS...Northeast 5 to 15 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. Highest ridgetops and peaks may see gusts of 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum relative humidity as low as 10 to 20 percent on Sunday. Poor relative humidity recoveries overnight in the 15 to 35 percent range. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest
